text: <!here|@here> Tomorrow evening there’s a LWD (League of Women Designers) PDX event going on at The Plant, featuring designer Dee Clements of Chicago-based textile studio, Herron.

Reminder next LWD Meeting is tomorrow @ 7pm
Date: Tuesday, October 4th @ 7 - 9pm
Location: Hosted by LWD member Susanna Hohmann at Terrazign
"The Plant"
939 SE Alder St (entrance on 9th Ave)
Topic:
Designer Dee Clements of Chicago-based textile studio Herron will share how she cultivates a strong design and art practice while collaborating with large companies like CB2, Land of Nod, and Room and Board. She will also share a recent workshop she led at Andrea Zittel's art and design compound A-Z West.
<http://studioherron.com/>
<http://www.sightunseen.com/2015/08/dee-clements-of-chicagos-herron-studio/>

attachments.title: Home
attachments.text: Herron is a textile brand + weaving studio specializing in woven blankets, rugs and wall panels. Founded by weaver and textile designer Dee Clements in a small attic on Chicago’s west side, Herron has grown into a design studio and textile brand, focusing on preserving and maintaining a commitment to ethical and environmental sustainability, traditional craft methodologies, and artistic process.

attachments.title: Dee Clements of Chicago's Herron Studio - Sight Unseen
attachments.text: For Dee Clements, who makes beautiful hand-woven goods out of her Chicago design studio, Herron, sustainability is key. “I know it’s an overused buzzword, but it’s really important,” she says. Though she’s talking about the environmental impact of large-scale textile production and why she mainly uses small-farm fibers that aren’t chemically or unethically produced, sustainability, in a creative sense, is also on her mind.
attachments.fallback: Sight Unseen: Dee Clements of Chicago's Herron Studio - Sight Unseen
